solution_line_template: The height of the sunflowers from Packet A is the same as the height of the sunflowers from Packet B + {percent_taller*100}%. If Y represents the height of the sunflowers from Packet B, Y + {percent_taller}Y = the height of sunflowers from Packet A.
We know the height of the sunflowers from Packet A is {packet_a_height} inches = Y + {percent_taller}Y or {packet_b_multiplier}Y.

To figure out Y, we would divide both sides of the equation by {packet_b_multiplier}, like this: {packet_a_height} / {packet_b_multiplier} = {packet_b_multiplier}Y / {packet_b_multiplier} or {packet_b_height} = Y.
